MODELATTRIBUTES.ATTRIBUTE: The grant management BP has been selected as reference point for the European Project Budget Report. Grant management includes some sub-process, they are: Periodic Report, Final Report, Manage Payment and eventually Manage Amendment. Considering intra-organizational perspective we following report the case of an Italian public research body acting as Coordinator or Beneficiary. In both the cases of the grant management BP is triggered by the notification of project acceptance and then it consider all the activity to report to the EU .
VIEW representation:graphic GRAPHIC x:331 y:236 w:807 h:440 scale:0.625116956075 TABLE

The relation 'Subsequent' defines the flow of activities and decisions in a Business Process.
It can be used to link all types of objects with the exception of 'Variable', 'Random generator', 'Resource', 'Aggregation', 'Performance indicator' and 'Performance indicator overview'.
The 'Subsequent' relation may contain a transition condition when it follows a Decision or Parallelity.

NOTEBOOK
#----------------------- LANG "en" #----------------------- CHAPTER "Description" ATTR "Denomination" ATTR "Description" ATTR "Comment"

ATTR "Default" ATTR "Immediate" ATTR "Category" ATTR "Id"
CHAPTER "Details (Simulation)"
ATTR "Transition condition" dialog:transcond
ATTR "Transition probability"

GRAPHREP rounded:0.1cm SHADOW off PEN style:dot w:0.03cm EDGE PEN style:solid w:0.03cm AVAL set-default:"Relation Node" fromType:"FromType" AVAL set-default:"Data Object" toType:"ToType" AVAL sRepr:"Representation" AVAL sRotate:"Rotate the visualised values by 90 degrees" AVAL sName: "Name"
END POLYLINE ({-0.3cm, 0.1cm, 0cm, 0cm, -0.3cm, -0.1cm})
MIDDLE SET aObjectArray: {"Task", "Sub-Process", "Start Event", "Intermediate Event (sequence flow)", "Intermediate Event (boundary)", "End Event", "Relation Node", "Data Object", "Exclusive Gateway", "Non-exclusive Gateway", "Non-exclusive Gateway (converging)"}
FONT "Arial" color:red bold IF (((fromType IN aObjectArray) != 1) OR ((toType IN aObjectArray) != 1)) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ELSIF ((fromType != "Data Object") AND (toType != "Data Object")) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ENDIF
AVAL showName:"Show name" IF (showName = "Yes") IF (sRepr = "above/below") IF (sRotate = "Yes") FONT line-orientation:90 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.2cm y:0.0cm w:c:(2.0cm) h:t ELSE FONT line-orientation:0 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.0cm y:0.2cm w:c:(2.0cm) h:t ENDIF ELSE IF (sRotate = "Yes") FONT line-orientation:90 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.0cm y:-0.2cm w:l:(2.0cm) h:c ELSE FONT line-orientation:0 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.2cm y:0.0cm w:l:(2.0cm) h:c ENDIF ENDIF ENDIF

A Message Flow is used to show the flow of messages between two participants that are prepared to send and receive them. In BPMN, two separate Pools in the Diagram will represent the two participants (e.g., business entities or business roles).
Note: -----
The info texts of this class and of all attributes are taken from the Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN) 1.0 OMG Final Adopted Specification (Version February 6, 2006).
The BPMN 1.0 Specification can be downloaded from the Object Management Group/Business Process Management Initiative website (http://www.bpmn.org).

EXPR expr:(set(targets, ctobjs("Is inside")), cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=0,"black", (cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=1,aval (VAL ctobjs("Is inside"), "Fontcolor"), ( set(tk,token(targets,0," ")), set(t,VAL (copy(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),search(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), fortok(x,targets," ", ( set(c,VAL (copy(aval(VAL x, "Position"),search(aval(VAL x, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), cond(c>=t,(set(res,x),set(t,c)),"") )), aval (VAL res, "Fontcolor") )) ) )) val:"black"

In this activity the International and Industrial Liaison office has to upload the Certificate for Financial Statement in the EU system. The data objects “CFS Copy” and “Certificate Form” in the state “Empty” are requested to perform this activity and the data object “Certificate Form” in the state “CFS” is generated in this activity.

CONNECTOR.ATTRIBUTE:
The relation 'Subsequent' defines the flow of activities and decisions in a Business Process.
It can be used to link all types of objects with the exception of 'Variable', 'Random generator', 'Resource', 'Aggregation', 'Performance indicator' and 'Performance indicator overview'.
The 'Subsequent' relation may contain a transition condition when it follows a Decision or Parallelity.

ATTRIBUTE.name: Rotate the visualised values by 90 degrees

ATTR "Auditing" ATTR "Monitoring"
ATTR "Default" ATTR "Immediate" ATTR "Category" ATTR "Id"
CHAPTER "Details (Simulation)"
ATTR "Transition condition" dialog:transcond
ATTR "Transition probability"

GRAPHREP rounded:0.1cm SHADOW off PEN style:dot w:0.03cm EDGE PEN style:solid w:0.03cm AVAL set-default:"Relation Node" fromType:"FromType" AVAL set-default:"Data Object" toType:"ToType" AVAL sRepr:"Representation" AVAL sRotate:"Rotate the visualised values by 90 degrees" AVAL sName: "Name"
END POLYLINE ({-0.3cm, 0.1cm, 0cm, 0cm, -0.3cm, -0.1cm})
MIDDLE SET aObjectArray: {"Task", "Sub-Process", "Start Event", "Intermediate Event (sequence flow)", "Intermediate Event (boundary)", "End Event", "Relation Node", "Data Object", "Exclusive Gateway", "Non-exclusive Gateway", "Non-exclusive Gateway (converging)"}
FONT "Arial" color:red bold IF (((fromType IN aObjectArray) != 1) OR ((toType IN aObjectArray) != 1)) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ELSIF ((fromType != "Data Object") AND (toType != "Data Object")) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ENDIF
AVAL showName:"Show name" IF (showName = "Yes") IF (sRepr = "above/below") IF (sRotate = "Yes") FONT line-orientation:90 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.2cm y:0.0cm w:c:(2.0cm) h:t ELSE FONT line-orientation:0 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.0cm y:0.2cm w:c:(2.0cm) h:t ENDIF ELSE IF (sRotate = "Yes") FONT line-orientation:90 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.0cm y:-0.2cm w:l:(2.0cm) h:c ELSE FONT line-orientation:0 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.2cm y:0.0cm w:l:(2.0cm) h:c ENDIF ENDIF ENDIF

INSTANCE.name: European Commission
INSTANCE.ATTRIBUTE: NODE x:0cm y:44.5cm w:79cm h:4cm index:86

ATTRIBUTE.name: Rotate the visualised values by 90 degrees

CONNECTOR.ATTRIBUTE:
The relation 'Subsequent' defines the flow of activities and decisions in a Business Process.
It can be used to link all types of objects with the exception of 'Variable', 'Random generator', 'Resource', 'Aggregation', 'Performance indicator' and 'Performance indicator overview'.
The 'Subsequent' relation may contain a transition condition when it follows a Decision or Parallelity.

ATTRIBUTE.name: Rotate the visualised values by 90 degrees

CONNECTOR.ATTRIBUTE:
NOTEBOOK
#----------------------- LANG "en" #----------------------- CHAPTER "Description" ATTR "Denomination" ATTR "Description" ATTR "Comment"
CHAPTER "Details (BPMN)"
ATTR "Auditing" ATTR "Monitoring"
ATTR "Default" ATTR "Immediate" ATTR "Category" ATTR "Id"
CHAPTER "Details (Simulation)"
ATTR "Transition condition" dialog:transcond
ATTR "Transition probability"

The relation 'Subsequent' defines the flow of activities and decisions in a Business Process.
It can be used to link all types of objects with the exception of 'Variable', 'Random generator', 'Resource', 'Aggregation', 'Performance indicator' and 'Performance indicator overview'.
The 'Subsequent' relation may contain a transition condition when it follows a Decision or Parallelity.

ATTRIBUTE.name: Rotate the visualised values by 90 degrees

CONNECTOR.ATTRIBUTE:
NOTEBOOK
#----------------------- LANG "en" #----------------------- CHAPTER "Description" ATTR "Denomination" ATTR "Description" ATTR "Comment"
CHAPTER "Details (BPMN)"
ATTR "Auditing" ATTR "Monitoring"
ATTR "Default" ATTR "Immediate" ATTR "Category" ATTR "Id"
CHAPTER "Details (Simulation)"
ATTR "Transition condition" dialog:transcond
ATTR "Transition probability"

GRAPHREP rounded:0.1cm SHADOW off PEN style:dot w:0.03cm EDGE PEN style:solid w:0.03cm AVAL set-default:"Relation Node" fromType:"FromType" AVAL set-default:"Data Object" toType:"ToType" AVAL sRepr:"Representation" AVAL sRotate:"Rotate the visualised values by 90 degrees" AVAL sName: "Name"
END POLYLINE ({-0.3cm, 0.1cm, 0cm, 0cm, -0.3cm, -0.1cm})
MIDDLE SET aObjectArray: {"Task", "Sub-Process", "Start Event", "Intermediate Event (sequence flow)", "Intermediate Event (boundary)", "End Event", "Relation Node", "Data Object", "Exclusive Gateway", "Non-exclusive Gateway", "Non-exclusive Gateway (converging)"}
FONT "Arial" color:red bold IF (((fromType IN aObjectArray) != 1) OR ((toType IN aObjectArray) != 1)) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ELSIF ((fromType != "Data Object") AND (toType != "Data Object")) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ENDIF
AVAL showName:"Show name" IF (showName = "Yes") IF (sRepr = "above/below") IF (sRotate = "Yes") FONT line-orientation:90 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.2cm y:0.0cm w:c:(2.0cm) h:t ELSE FONT line-orientation:0 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.0cm y:0.2cm w:c:(2.0cm) h:t ENDIF ELSE IF (sRotate = "Yes") FONT line-orientation:90 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.0cm y:-0.2cm w:l:(2.0cm) h:c ELSE FONT line-orientation:0 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.2cm y:0.0cm w:l:(2.0cm) h:c ENDIF ENDIF ENDIF

The relation 'Subsequent' defines the flow of activities and decisions in a Business Process.
It can be used to link all types of objects with the exception of 'Variable', 'Random generator', 'Resource', 'Aggregation', 'Performance indicator' and 'Performance indicator overview'.
The 'Subsequent' relation may contain a transition condition when it follows a Decision or Parallelity.

AVAL set-default:"Task" toType:"ToType" AVAL set-default:"Task" fromType:"FromType" AVAL showName:"Show name" AVAL name:"Name" AVAL sRepr:"Representation" AVAL sRotate:"Rotate the visualised values by 90 degrees" AVAL sName: "Name"
PEN style:dash w:0.06cm EDGE PEN w:0.03cm FILL color:white
START IF (fromType != "Relation Node") ELLIPSE x:0cm y:0cm rx:0.1cm ry:0.1cm ENDIF
END IF (toType != "Relation Node") POLYGON 3 x1:-.33cm y1:-.11cm x2:0.0cm y2:0.0cm x3:-.33cm y3:0.11cm ENDIF
MIDDLE SET aObjectArray: {"Pool", "Pool (collapsed)", "Task", "Sub-Process", "Choreography Task", "Sub-Choreography", "Start Event", "Intermediate Event (sequence flow)", "Intermediate Event (boundary)", "End Event", "Relation Node"}

IF (showName = "Yes") IF (sRepr = "above/below") IF (sRotate = "Yes") FONT line-orientation:90 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.2cm y:0.0cm w:c:(2.0cm) h:t ELSE FONT line-orientation:0 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.0cm y:0.2cm w:c:(2.0cm) h:t ENDIF ELSE IF (sRotate = "Yes") FONT line-orientation:90 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.0cm y:-0.2cm w:l:(2.0cm) h:c ELSE FONT line-orientation:0 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.2cm y:0.0cm w:l:(2.0cm) h:c ENDIF ENDIF ENDIF

A Message Flow is used to show the flow of messages between two participants that are prepared to send and receive them. In BPMN, two separate Pools in the Diagram will represent the two participants (e.g., business entities or business roles).
Note: -----
The info texts of this class and of all attributes are taken from the Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN) 1.0 OMG Final Adopted Specification (Version February 6, 2006).
The BPMN 1.0 Specification can be downloaded from the Object Management Group/Business Process Management Initiative website (http://www.bpmn.org).

EDGE PEN style:solid w:0.03cm AVAL dir:"Direction" AVAL set-default:"Relation Node" fromType:"FromType" AVAL set-default:"Group" toType:"ToType" AVAL sRepr:"Representation" AVAL sRotate:"Rotate the visualised values by 90 degrees" AVAL sName_de: "Name"
SET sName: (sName_de)
END IF ((dir = "To" OR dir = "Both") AND (toType != "Relation Node")) POLYLINE ({-0.3cm, 0.1cm, 0cm, 0cm, -0.3cm, -0.1cm}) ENDIF
START IF ((dir = "From" OR dir = "Both") AND (fromType != "Relation Node")) POLYLINE ({-0.3cm, 0.1cm, 0cm, 0cm, -0.3cm, -0.1cm}) ENDIF
MIDDLE SET aObjectArray: {"Task", "Sub-Process", "Choreography Task", "Sub-Choreography", "Start Event", "Intermediate Event (sequence flow)", "Intermediate Event (boundary)", "End Event", "Relation Node", "Data Object", "Exclusive Gateway", "Non-exclusive Gateway", "Non-exclusive Gateway (converging)", "Group", "Text Annotation"}
FONT "Arial" color:red bold IF (fromType = "Message") IF ((toType != "Choreography Task") AND (toType != "Sub-Choreography") AND (toType != "Relation Node")) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ENDIF ELSIF (toType = "Message") IF ((fromType != "Choreography Task") AND (fromType != "Sub-Choreography") AND (fromType != "Relation Node")) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ENDIF ELSE IF (((fromType IN aObjectArray) != 1) OR ((toType IN aObjectArray) != 1)) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ELSIF (((fromType != "Group") AND (fromType != "Text Annotation")) AND ((toType != "Group") AND (toType != "Text Annotation"))) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ELSIF (((fromType = "Group") OR (fromType = "Text Annotation")) AND ((toType = "Group") OR (toType = "Text Annotation"))) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ENDIF ENDIF
AVAL showName:"Show name" IF (showName = "Yes") IF (sRepr = "above/below") IF (sRotate = "Yes") FONT line-orientation:90 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.2cm y:0.0cm w:c:(2.0cm) h:t ELSE FONT line-orientation:0 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.0cm y:0.2cm w:c:(2.0cm) h:t ENDIF ELSE IF (sRotate = "Yes") FONT line-orientation:90 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.0cm y:-0.2cm w:l:(2.0cm) h:c ELSE FONT line-orientation:0 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.2cm y:0.0cm w:l:(2.0cm) h:c ENDIF ENDIF ENDIF

The BPMN 1.0 Specification can be downloaded from the Object Management Group/Business Process Management Initiative website (http://www.bpmn.org).

START IF ((dir = "From" OR dir = "Both") AND (fromType != "Relation Node")) POLYLINE ({-0.3cm, 0.1cm, 0cm, 0cm, -0.3cm, -0.1cm}) ENDIF

INSTANCE.name: Start Event-12884
INSTANCE.ATTRIBUTE: EXPR expr:(set(targets, ctobjs("Is inside")), cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=0,"black", (cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=1,aval (VAL ctobjs("Is inside"), "Fontcolor"), ( set(tk,token(targets,0," ")), set(t,VAL (copy(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),search(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), fortok(x,targets," ", ( set(c,VAL (copy(aval(VAL x, "Position"),search(aval(VAL x, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), cond(c>=t,(set(res,x),set(t,c)),"") )), aval (VAL res, "Fontcolor") )) ) )) val:"black"
The subprocess "Manage Scientific Activities" is started

INSTANCE.name: Write Deliverable
INSTANCE.ATTRIBUTE: NODE x:14cm y:1.5cm w:3.36cm h:1.8cm index:2

EXPR expr:(set(targets, ctobjs("Is inside")), cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=0,"black", (cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=1,aval (VAL ctobjs("Is inside"), "Fontcolor"), ( set(tk,token(targets,0," ")), set(t,VAL (copy(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),search(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), fortok(x,targets," ", ( set(c,VAL (copy(aval(VAL x, "Position"),search(aval(VAL x, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), cond(c>=t,(set(res,x),set(t,c)),"") )), aval (VAL res, "Fontcolor") )) ) )) val:"black"
In this activity researchers have to write the deliverables of the project both as editors and contributors.

INSTANCE.ATTRIBUTE: NODE x:14cm y:11.5cm w:3.36cm h:1.8cm index:13

The relation 'Subsequent' defines the flow of activities and decisions in a Business Process.
It can be used to link all types of objects with the exception of 'Variable', 'Random generator', 'Resource', 'Aggregation', 'Performance indicator' and 'Performance indicator overview'.
The 'Subsequent' relation may contain a transition condition when it follows a Decision or Parallelity.

GRAPHREP rounded:0.1cm SHADOW off
AVAL set-default:"Task" toType:"ToType" AVAL set-default:"Task" fromType:"FromType" AVAL showName:"Show name" AVAL name:"Name" AVAL sRepr:"Representation" AVAL sRotate:"Rotate the visualised values by 90 degrees" AVAL sName: "Name"
PEN style:dash w:0.06cm EDGE PEN w:0.03cm FILL color:white
START IF (fromType != "Relation Node") ELLIPSE x:0cm y:0cm rx:0.1cm ry:0.1cm ENDIF
END IF (toType != "Relation Node") POLYGON 3 x1:-.33cm y1:-.11cm x2:0.0cm y2:0.0cm x3:-.33cm y3:0.11cm ENDIF
MIDDLE SET aObjectArray: {"Pool", "Pool (collapsed)", "Task", "Sub-Process", "Choreography Task", "Sub-Choreography", "Start Event", "Intermediate Event (sequence flow)", "Intermediate Event (boundary)", "End Event", "Relation Node"}
FONT "Arial" color:red bold IF (((fromType IN aObjectArray) != 1) OR ((toType IN aObjectArray) != 1)) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ELSIF ((fromType = "Start Event") OR (toType = "End Event") OR ((fromType = "Relation Node") AND (toType = "Relation Node"))) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ENDIF
IF (showName = "Yes") IF (sRepr = "above/below") IF (sRotate = "Yes") FONT line-orientation:90 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.2cm y:0.0cm w:c:(2.0cm) h:t ELSE FONT line-orientation:0 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.0cm y:0.2cm w:c:(2.0cm) h:t ENDIF ELSE IF (sRotate = "Yes") FONT line-orientation:90 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.0cm y:-0.2cm w:l:(2.0cm) h:c ELSE FONT line-orientation:0 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.2cm y:0.0cm w:l:(2.0cm) h:c ENDIF ENDIF ENDIF

A Message Flow is used to show the flow of messages between two participants that are prepared to send and receive them. In BPMN, two separate Pools in the Diagram will represent the two participants (e.g., business entities or business roles).
Note: -----
The info texts of this class and of all attributes are taken from the Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN) 1.0 OMG Final Adopted Specification (Version February 6, 2006).
The BPMN 1.0 Specification can be downloaded from the Object Management Group/Business Process Management Initiative website (http://www.bpmn.org).

CONNECTOR.ATTRIBUTE:
The relation 'Subsequent' defines the flow of activities and decisions in a Business Process.
It can be used to link all types of objects with the exception of 'Variable', 'Random generator', 'Resource', 'Aggregation', 'Performance indicator' and 'Performance indicator overview'.
The 'Subsequent' relation may contain a transition condition when it follows a Decision or Parallelity.

A Message Flow is used to show the flow of messages between two participants that are prepared to send and receive them. In BPMN, two separate Pools in the Diagram will represent the two participants (e.g., business entities or business roles).
Note: -----
The info texts of this class and of all attributes are taken from the Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN) 1.0 OMG Final Adopted Specification (Version February 6, 2006).
The BPMN 1.0 Specification can be downloaded from the Object Management Group/Business Process Management Initiative website (http://www.bpmn.org).

INSTANCE.name: Grant Agreement
INSTANCE.ATTRIBUTE: NODE x:5cm y:7.5cm w:2cm h:1.89cm index:1

EXPR expr:(set(targets, ctobjs("Is inside")), cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=0,"black", (cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=1,aval (VAL ctobjs("Is inside"), "Fontcolor"), ( set(tk,token(targets,0," ")), set(t,VAL (copy(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),search(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), fortok(x,targets," ", ( set(c,VAL (copy(aval(VAL x, "Position"),search(aval(VAL x, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), cond(c>=t,(set(res,x),set(t,c)),"") )), aval (VAL res, "Fontcolor") )) ) )) val:error:"[acoexpar-02] Attribute \"Fontcolor\" (Group) does not exist! \"fontcolor\" (Document)"

It is the data object representing the legal instrument reflecting the relationship between the EU Commission and the project coordinator, acting on behalf of the project partners. The data-object reflects a standard template consolidated by the EU commission and report terms and conditions referring to accession to the grant agreement of the other beneficiaries, duration and start date of the project, reporting period, pre-financing, etc. The data object is composed by core information and annexes, which form an integral part of this grant agreement.

INSTANCE.ATTRIBUTE: EXPR expr:(set(targets, ctobjs("Is inside")), cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=0,"black", (cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=1,aval (VAL ctobjs("Is inside"), "Fontcolor"), ( set(tk,token(targets,0," ")), set(t,VAL (copy(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),search(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), fortok(x,targets," ", ( set(c,VAL (copy(aval(VAL x, "Position"),search(aval(VAL x, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), cond(c>=t,(set(res,x),set(t,c)),"") )), aval (VAL res, "Fontcolor") )) ) )) val:error:"[acoexpar-02] Attribute \"Fontcolor\" (Group) does not exist! \"fontcolor\" (Document)"

It is the data object representing the legal instrument reflecting the relationships among the partner of the consortium. It is consistent with the Grant Agreement and it presents preliminary clauses (title, preamble, etc.), technical provisions, financial structure and management structure, Intellectual Property, dispute resolution system and final clauses (applicable law termination). The data object is composed by core information and annexes, which form an integral part of this consortium agreement.

INSTANCE.ATTRIBUTE: EXPR expr:(set(targets, ctobjs("Is inside")), cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=0,"black", (cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=1,aval (VAL ctobjs("Is inside"), "Fontcolor"), ( set(tk,token(targets,0," ")), set(t,VAL (copy(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),search(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), fortok(x,targets," ", ( set(c,VAL (copy(aval(VAL x, "Position"),search(aval(VAL x, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), cond(c>=t,(set(res,x),set(t,c)),"") )), aval (VAL res, "Fontcolor") )) ) )) val:error:"[acoexpar-02] Attribute \"Fontcolor\" (Group) does not exist! \"fontcolor\" (Document)"

It contains all the information related to financial cost claim. The form is adapted to take into account information such as the beneficiary, the funding schemes, etc. The general structure is extended by two main parts, the first one contains all the direct cost of a participant, whereas a second one contains all the indirect cost of a participant. Form C can be signed by the participant or not, as soon as it is signed it can be submitted to the project coordinator.

The relation "has Subdocument" connects two objects of the class "Document" hierarchically.
It is used from an upper graded Document to a subordinated Document.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Die Beziehung "hat Subdokument" verbindet zwei Objekte der Klasse "Dokument" hierarchisch.
Die Verbindung wird vom übergeordneten Dokument zum untergeordneten Dokument gezogen.

CONNECTOR.ATTRIBUTE:
The relation 'Subsequent' defines the flow of activities and decisions in a Business Process.
It can be used to link all types of objects with the exception of 'Variable', 'Random generator', 'Resource', 'Aggregation', 'Performance indicator' and 'Performance indicator overview'.
The 'Subsequent' relation may contain a transition condition when it follows a Decision or Parallelity.

ATTRIBUTE.name: Rotate the visualised values by 90 degrees

GRAPHREP rounded:0.1cm SHADOW off PEN style:dot w:0.03cm EDGE PEN style:solid w:0.03cm AVAL set-default:"Relation Node" fromType:"FromType" AVAL set-default:"Data Object" toType:"ToType" AVAL sRepr:"Representation" AVAL sRotate:"Rotate the visualised values by 90 degrees" AVAL sName: "Name"
END POLYLINE ({-0.3cm, 0.1cm, 0cm, 0cm, -0.3cm, -0.1cm})
MIDDLE SET aObjectArray: {"Task", "Sub-Process", "Start Event", "Intermediate Event (sequence flow)", "Intermediate Event (boundary)", "End Event", "Relation Node", "Data Object", "Exclusive Gateway", "Non-exclusive Gateway", "Non-exclusive Gateway (converging)"}
FONT "Arial" color:red bold IF (((fromType IN aObjectArray) != 1) OR ((toType IN aObjectArray) != 1)) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ELSIF ((fromType != "Data Object") AND (toType != "Data Object")) TEXT "!" x:0.1cm y:0.0cm w:l h:b ENDIF
AVAL showName:"Show name" IF (showName = "Yes") IF (sRepr = "above/below") IF (sRotate = "Yes") FONT line-orientation:90 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.2cm y:0.0cm w:c:(2.0cm) h:t ELSE FONT line-orientation:0 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.0cm y:0.2cm w:c:(2.0cm) h:t ENDIF ELSE IF (sRotate = "Yes") FONT line-orientation:90 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.0cm y:-0.2cm w:l:(2.0cm) h:c ELSE FONT line-orientation:0 ATTR "Name" text:(sName) line-break:words x:0.2cm y:0.0cm w:l:(2.0cm) h:c ENDIF ENDIF ENDIF

INSTANCE.name: University of Camerino
INSTANCE.ATTRIBUTE: EXPR expr:(set(targets, ctobjs("Is inside")), cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=0,"black", (cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=1,aval (VAL ctobjs("Is inside"), "Fontcolor"), ( set(tk,token(targets,0," ")), set(t,VAL (copy(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),search(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), fortok(x,targets," ", ( set(c,VAL (copy(aval(VAL x, "Position"),search(aval(VAL x, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), cond(c>=t,(set(res,x),set(t,c)),"") )), aval (VAL res, "Fontcolor") )) ) )) val:"black"
The University of Camerino is a public institution of higher education participating in the construction of the European Research Area and the European Higher Education Area.

INSTANCE.name: EPBR Competencies
INSTANCE.ATTRIBUTE: NODE x:.5cm y:1.5cm w:16.5cm h:15cm index:7

INSTANCE.name: Manage a research problem
INSTANCE.ATTRIBUTE: EXPR expr:(set(targets, ctobjs("Is inside")), cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=0,"black", (cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=1,aval (VAL ctobjs("Is inside"), "Fontcolor"), ( set(tk,token(targets,0," ")), set(t,VAL (copy(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),search(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), fortok(x,targets," ", ( set(c,VAL (copy(aval(VAL x, "Position"),search(aval(VAL x, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), cond(c>=t,(set(res,x),set(t,c)),"") )), aval (VAL res, "Fontcolor") )) ) )) val:error:"[acoexpar-02] Attribute \"Fontcolor\" (Group) does not exist! \"fontcolor\" (Competency)"

Analytical skills - Identify emerging issues in the area of the project proposal. Define novel approaches and solutions on the project topic. Self-organization capacities. Leanership capacity, with ability of: motivating the team, giving feedback in regard to the execution of tasks, setting clear objectives for the work of the team, building effective task-oriented teams for accomplishing objectives. Diagnostic skills - Cognitive aspects in particular the capacity of logical, intuitive and creative thinking. Implementation skills. Being objective in case of conflicts and being able to find solutions which satisfies everyone. Use of tools, methods, and instruments related to the management of scientific activities. High capacity of decision making in particular under uncertain situation and with care on decision time, gathering useful information and tools. High capacity of team working, establishing good relationship and sharing team’s successes with others.
Knowledge of the literature concerning the project topic and involved aspects. Problem solving and decision making techniques. English Language.

INSTANCE.name: Manage the participation at events
INSTANCE.ATTRIBUTE: EXPR expr:(set(targets, ctobjs("Is inside")), cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=0,"black", (cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=1,aval (VAL ctobjs("Is inside"), "Fontcolor"), ( set(tk,token(targets,0," ")), set(t,VAL (copy(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),search(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), fortok(x,targets," ", ( set(c,VAL (copy(aval(VAL x, "Position"),search(aval(VAL x, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), cond(c>=t,(set(res,x),set(t,c)),"") )), aval (VAL res, "Fontcolor") )) ) )) val:error:"[acoexpar-02] Attribute \"Fontcolor\" (Group) does not exist! \"fontcolor\" (Competency)"

Analytical skills - Identify events and manage procedures for the authorization to take part at the event and be refunded. High communication capacity with particular care at possible communication barriers, and the audience capacity of receiving the expressed messages. Diagnostic skills - Be able to promote and advertise the project with particular care at the definition of target group and creativeness and explaining the added-value of the project. Implementation skills - Use of instruments suitable to present a work (e. g. powerpoint). Use of tool related to the management of a mission.

Knowing about possible events; internal manual and procedure for mission management (request and refund). Some Internal rules and procedure governed by regulation are: Mobility Regulation, Research Activity Regulation, and Budget Management Regulation.

INSTANCE.name: Manage administrative procedure
INSTANCE.ATTRIBUTE: EXPR expr:(set(targets, ctobjs("Is inside")), cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=0,"black", (cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=1,aval (VAL ctobjs("Is inside"), "Fontcolor"), ( set(tk,token(targets,0," ")), set(t,VAL (copy(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),search(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), fortok(x,targets," ", ( set(c,VAL (copy(aval(VAL x, "Position"),search(aval(VAL x, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), cond(c>=t,(set(res,x),set(t,c)),"") )), aval (VAL res, "Fontcolor") )) ) )) val:error:"[acoexpar-02] Attribute \"Fontcolor\" (Group) does not exist! \"fontcolor\" (Competency)"
Manage and coordinate the specific administration procedures related to the periodic report, including financial aspects and technical details.

Analytical skills: High capacity of analyse the purpose of the project, setting generic and specific objectives carrying out the need analysis of the project. Selection and gathering of information related to all the activities done in the project, used budget, person months involved, etc. Diagnostic skills - Activate control procedures of data and documentation, identifying any anomalies and irregularities, according to sectoral laws. Implementation skills - Apply EU regulation to check the regularity of documentation. Apply editing technique, using standard format to write formal communications and report. Coordinate the participants involved in the reporting using EU information systems.

U-GOV and ECAS tools. English Language. Supporting documents and manual (https://ec.europa.eu/research/participants/portal/desktop/en/funding/guide.html). Law no. 240 of 30 December 2010 concerning the organization of Universities (the so-called Gelmini law). Legislative Decree No 163 of 12 April 2006 - Code of public contracts of works, services and supplies in implementation of Directives 2004/17/EC and 2004/18/EC.

INSTANCE.name: Manage digital signature
INSTANCE.ATTRIBUTE: EXPR expr:(set(targets, ctobjs("Is inside")), cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=0,"black", (cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=1,aval (VAL ctobjs("Is inside"), "Fontcolor"), ( set(tk,token(targets,0," ")), set(t,VAL (copy(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),search(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), fortok(x,targets," ", ( set(c,VAL (copy(aval(VAL x, "Position"),search(aval(VAL x, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), cond(c>=t,(set(res,x),set(t,c)),"") )), aval (VAL res, "Fontcolor") )) ) )) val:error:"[acoexpar-02] Attribute \"Fontcolor\" (Group) does not exist! \"fontcolor\" (Competency)"
Diagnostic skills: analyse formal documentation in order to point out any irregularities; Implementation skills: use of instruments related to the digital sign.
Digital Signature software and tools. ECAS tool;

INSTANCE.name: Manage financial flow
INSTANCE.ATTRIBUTE: EXPR expr:(set(targets, ctobjs("Is inside")), cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=0,"black", (cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=1,aval (VAL ctobjs("Is inside"), "Fontcolor"), ( set(tk,token(targets,0," ")), set(t,VAL (copy(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),search(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), fortok(x,targets," ", ( set(c,VAL (copy(aval(VAL x, "Position"),search(aval(VAL x, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), cond(c>=t,(set(res,x),set(t,c)),"") )), aval (VAL res, "Fontcolor") )) ) )) val:error:"[acoexpar-02] Attribute \"Fontcolor\" (Group) does not exist! \"fontcolor\" (Competency)"

Diagnostic skills: activate control financial flow and related documentation identifying any anomalies and irregularities in accordance to sectoral laws; being able to communicate with accounting departments and funding authority on financial issues. Analytical skills: Capacity of control the project budget in the course of its implementation and change it if need considering direct and indirect cost as well as subcontracting if needed.
Understanding of the principles and means of financial management. Related regulation and internal documents.

INSTANCE.name: Manage a project meeting
INSTANCE.ATTRIBUTE: EXPR expr:(set(targets, ctobjs("Is inside")), cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=0,"black", (cond (tokcnt(targets," ")=1,aval (VAL ctobjs("Is inside"), "Fontcolor"), ( set(tk,token(targets,0," ")), set(t,VAL (copy(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),search(aval(VAL tk, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), fortok(x,targets," ", ( set(c,VAL (copy(aval(VAL x, "Position"),search(aval(VAL x, "Position"),"index",0)+6,-1))), cond(c>=t,(set(res,x),set(t,c)),"") )), aval (VAL res, "Fontcolor") )) ) )) val:error:"[acoexpar-02] Attribute \"Fontcolor\" (Group) does not exist! \"fontcolor\" (Competency)"

Diagnostic skills: Flexibility during the work activity; in particular when dealing with unexpected situations adapting project activities to changing circumstance. High focus and perseverance to meet project goals despite different obstacles. High capacity of problem solving and be able to analyze a situation and come up with the best possible solution.
Problem solving and decision making techniques. English Language.
